Package controllers

Class UpdateMinLimitController

java.lang.Object
controllers.AbstractController
controllers.UpdateMinLimitController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class UpdateMinLimitController extends AbstractController implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
UpdateMinLimitController is the controller for handling minimum limit of products. It extends AbstractController and overrides methods of it.

    String
    buildMinQuantityUpdateQuery()
    builds an update query for updating the db with new min quantitys example of a query will look like that : UPDATE storeproduct SET lim = (case WHEN pid = 1 AND sid = 1 then 15 WHEN pid = 2 AND sid = 1 then 15 end) WHERE pid in (1,2) AND sid = 1;

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Overrides the initialize method of JavaFX - initializes our controller loads to locations comboBox the relevant store locations whether regionManager or CEO
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      rb - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

      public void loadItemsToTable(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

      Parameters:

    • onMinQuantityCommit

      public void onMinQuantityCommit(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn.CellEditEvent event)
      adds the edited product to a List of products to update in db the List in initialized every time we pick another store location (in loadItemsToTable func)
      Parameters:
      event - catches the CellEditEvent

    • updateMinQuantity

      public void updateMinQuantity(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      triggered when we click 'Save' - sends update query to db
      Parameters:
      event - catches the ActionEvent

    • buildMinQuantityUpdateQuery

      public String buildMinQuantityUpdateQuery()
      builds an update query for updating the db with new min quantitys example of a query will look like that : UPDATE storeproduct SET lim = (case WHEN pid = 1 AND sid = 1 then 15 WHEN pid = 2 AND sid = 1 then 15 end) WHERE pid in (1,2) AND sid = 1;
      Returns:
      an update query
